page.title: 10Footpaths of Vernham Dean CP
page.content: The area is well served with footpaths and bridleways and they are all well used and well kept. A favorite walk starts opposite the old bakery in Vernham Dean and heads south along a track to Thornycombe Wood and thence to the derelict Lower Conholt Farm. The path then descends to Well Bottom before climbing to Cow Down, with extensive views to the south. The path then turns east and passes the highest point before decending Rushmore Down to the village of Upton and the lowest point. The village also has the only pub in the area. The return to Vernham Dean may be made along the road or along tracks to the north of the area.
